physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features three individuals, two men and one woman, in the photograph. The woman is looking forward, while the two men are looking at each other. The men are dressed in shirt and tie. The woman is holding a bouquet of flowers in her hand. There are no inscriptions seen in the photograph. There are no tears and folds on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: George Lowe was a member of the British Expedition that saw Sir Edmund Hillary scale Mount Everest on 29 May 1953. In September that year, Lowe accompanied Hillary on a visit to Singapore to deliver their first Everest lecture outside of New Zealand at the Odeon Theatre to an audience of 1,620 schoolchildren. This photograph album, with the coat of arms of the City of Singapore in gilt on the cover, was presented to Lowe as a souvenir of his visit.
title_text: Photograph album presented to George Lowe as a souvenir of his visit to Singapore George Lowe album: Photograph of Sir Edmund Hillary, Lady Hillary, and George Lowe
subject_terms_2: Photographs Photograph albums Souvenir Lowe, George, 1924-2013 Hillary, Edmund, 1919-2008 Portraits, Group
